items.title: Are you Japanese?
items.comment: A common way to ask someone if they are Japanese.

items.text: 我不是日本人，我是巴西人。
items.title: I'm not Japanese, I'm Brazilian.
items.pinyin: wǒ bù shì rìběn rén, wǒ shì bāxī rén.
items.pronounce: waw boo shrr rrr-ben ren, waw shrr baa-shee ren.
items.comment: Used to clarify your nationality when someone asks if you are Japanese.

items.title: Brazil
items.comment: Brazil, the largest country in South America.

items.title: China
items.comment: China, the most populous country in the world.

items.title: United Kingdom
items.comment: The United Kingdom (UK), including England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland.

items.title: France
items.comment: France, a country in Western Europe known for its culture and cuisine.

items.title: Italy
items.comment: Italy, a European country known for its history, art, and food.

items.title: I'm Chinese
items.comment: A common way to say 'I'm Chinese.' Used in both formal and casual situations.

items.title: Brazilian
items.comment: Refers to a person from Brazil.
